results.title: Buddurri Healing
results.creator_credit: Jason Davis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Identity - Dreaming - Destruction - Healing - Sharing - Unity - Hunting - Identity.’ This is Jason Davis’ healing story and about his connection to his Indigenous culture.

results.title: Streets of Fitzroy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Mick Booth
results.brief_description: Mick Booth was brought up in Kent Street, Fitzroy - an inner suburb of Melbourne. This is his story of childhood memories, family and growing up in Fitzroy.
results.description: Mick Booth was brought up in Kent Street, Fitzroy - an inner suburb of Melbourne. This is his story of childhood memories, family and growing up in Fitzroy.

results.title: Leaving My Country
results.creator_credit: Grant Hood, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: An argument with his uncle one night would turn out to be a life-changing experience for Grant Hood, a proud Kurnai Gunai man. Grant mentions the importance of his meeting with Kutcha Edwards when he first arrives in Melbourne. A photo of a very young Kutcha is also shown.

results.title: Rosalie's journey
results.brief_description: The film presents Rosalie (Ngarla) Kunoth-Monks speaking for the first time in her Arrente language. It tells the other side to the film which in 1955 was one of a kind: first full colour feature film and first to feature Aboriginal actors with speaking parts. The program is about Rosalie’s life before and after ‘Jedda’, her life in central Australia as a young woman and the profound cultural challenges she faced when selected by Charles Chauvel to play the lead role in ‘Jedda’ in 1955. Includes archival footage and excerpts from ‘Jedda’ including some b&w scenes.
results.description: The film presents Rosalie (Ngarla) Kunoth-Monks speaking for the first time in her Arrente language. It tells the other side to the film which in 1955 was one of a kind: first full colour feature film and first to feature Aboriginal actors with speaking parts. The program is about Rosalie’s life before and after ‘Jedda’, her life in central Australia as a young woman and the profound cultural challenges she faced when selected by Charles Chauvel to play the lead role in ‘Jedda’ in 1955. Includes archival footage and excerpts from ‘Jedda’ including some b&w scenes.

Includes archival footage and excerpts from ‘Jedda’ including some b&w scenes.

results.title: Two bob mermaid
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Antonia Barnard and Core Films
results.brief_description: In this visually stunning short film set in the 1950s, a fair-skinned Aboriginal girl gains access to the local swimming pool where Aboriginal people are legally denied access (Source: Australian Screen)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darlene Johnson, Antonia Barnard and Core Films
results.description: In this visually stunning short film set in the 1950s, a fair-skinned Aboriginal girl gains access to the local swimming pool where Aboriginal people are legally denied access (Source: Australian Screen)

results.title: Round up
results.brief_description: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.description: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
description_for_label: Round Up follows the journey of two country boys who find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. Here in this unfamiliar environment, they may learn that they are not as different as they first thought.
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Passing through
results.brief_description: A young family on their way to visit relatives pass through an old gold mining town. As the woman begins to delve into memories of her childhood, the family leave to continue their journey. Has she missed the opportunity to discover the secrets of the past?
results.description: A young family on their way to visit relatives pass through an old gold mining town. As the woman begins to delve into memories of her childhood, the family leave to continue their journey. Has she missed the opportunity to discover the secrets of the past?
description_for_label: A young family on their way to visit relatives pass through an old gold mining town. As the woman begins to delve into memories of her childhood, the family leave to continue their journey. Has she missed the opportunity to discover the secrets of the past?

results.title: Nice coloured girls
results.brief_description: Nice Coloured Girls contrasts the relationship between Aboriginal women and white men in the past and the present. The film juxtaposes contemporary images of black women taking advantage of a white man with voice over extracts from early journals of white settlers and sailors, in order to question the validity of conventional white history and to deny the image of Aborigines as passive and powerless.
results.description: Nice Coloured Girls contrasts the relationship between Aboriginal women and white men in the past and the present. The film juxtaposes contemporary images of black women taking advantage of a white man with voice over extracts from early journals of white settlers and sailors, in order to question the validity of conventional white history and to deny the image of Aborigines as passive and powerless.

results.title: My colour, your kind
results.brief_description: A young girl, incarcerated in a dormitory, escapes to her rightful place in the world. During the journey she recollects her life and the treatment she has endured. In My Colour, Your Kind director Danielle Mclean uses her experience as a fair skinned Aborigine to explore the notion of Aboriginal identity.
